meanings.sent1: The toy had a replaceable battery that could be easily switched out.
meanings.sent2: The broken part was replaceable with a new one from the store.
meanings.sent3: It was funny how the robot thought its replaceable arm was a detachable toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a replaceable light bulb, always ready to brighten up a room.
meanings.sent5: The idea of having a replaceable outfit for every occasion seemed quite practical.

meanings.definition: Able to be substituted or exchanged for something else.
meanings.sent1: The generic brand was a replaceable option for the expensive one.
meanings.sent2: His position at work was replaceable, as there were many qualified candidates.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said her cat was replaceable, but we all knew she adored him.
meanings.sent4: The old chair was like a replaceable actor in a play, ready to be swapped out.
meanings.sent5: The key to success was having a replaceable plan for any unexpected challenges.
